cont.entity_a: Produces magical photos without post-processing. Photos are out of focus compared to other Canon lenses. Excellent wide-angle capabilities with amazing optics. Sharp and performs well in low light with f/2.8. Sharp in the center, less sharp in corners. Superb contrast and sharpness. Crisp, clear, colorful wide-angle shots. Sharp images with no vignetting or distortion. Excellent image quality and fast focus. Excellent clarity and color edge-to-edge. Sharp, good color, and fast focus. Superb contrast and sharpness typical of Canon L lenses. Stunning clarity and color. Super sharp even wide open.
cont.entity_b: Soft at 28mm, sharper at 50mm-80mm. Soft at f/3.5 and f/18+, best at f/11. Incredible price for the sharpness and color rendition.

cont.entity_a: Pricy but worth the investment. Expensive filters required. Expensive but worth the extra cost and weight.
cont.entity_b: Good value for the price. Incredible price for the sharpness and color rendition.

Great for indoor group shots. Fast accurate autofocus, even in low light. Fast autofocus and great bokeh.
cont.entity_b: AF is a little bit slow.

Better results on full-frame cameras than crop sensors. Great in low light and for landscapes. Bright and works perfectly on Canon 5D Mark III. Bright, fast, and useful range on Canon 7D.
cont.entity_b: Good for portraits and landscapes. Good all-purpose lens for general use.
